page.title: 12The Convent of St. Lucy.
page.content:
The convent of St. Lucy is in the centre of Medstead. It is a Roman Catholic convent, and occupies a large house that used to be called Medstead Manor. The Manor was bought in 1955 by the Maxwell family from Alresford who then gave it to the Sisters. The Sisters belong to the Religious Teaching Order of St.Lucy Filippini.
The Order has 5 sisters, (3 American, 2 Italian) and runs a guest house for old ladies which has 14 guests at the moment, and a Nursery School for 45 children that was opened in 1962.
The convent has 30 acres of land.
